[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: set_data_dir()] [Path Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious path values through set_data_dir() that cause safety_rules to read/write data to unauthorized locations, potentially leaking private keys or corrupting safety data? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: set_data_dir()] [Race Condition] Can concurrent calls to set_data_dir() create race conditions where safety rules data directory is changed mid-operation, causing corruption of safety state or double-signing vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: enable_broadcast_vote()] [Vote Broadcast Manipulation] Can a Byzantine validator exploit enable_broadcast_vote() by toggling vote broadcasting on/off to selectively reveal votes, enabling strategic withholding and consensus manipulation? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: enable_broadcast_vote()] [Configuration Inconsistency] Can mismatched broadcast_vote settings across validators (some true, some false) cause consensus divergence where votes don't propagate correctly? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: max_blocks_per_sending_request()] [Quorum Store Override Bypass] Can an attacker exploit the conditional logic in max_blocks_per_sending_request() by manipulating quorum_store_enabled state to request more blocks than allowed (switching between 10 and 10, but override should be 100)? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: max_blocks_per_sending_request()] [Block Retrieval DoS] Can a malicious node request max_blocks_per_sending_request_quorum_store_override (10) blocks repeatedly to exhaust sender resources and cause retrieval DoS? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: max_blocks_per_receiving_request()] [Receive Limit Bypass] Can an attacker exploit max_blocks_per_receiving_request() to send max_blocks_per_receiving_request_quorum_store_override (100) blocks when quorum store is enabled, overwhelming receiver memory and causing crashes? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: max_blocks_per_receiving_request()] [Send/Receive Mismatch] Can inconsistencies between max_blocks_per_sending_request (10) and max_blocks_per_receiving_request (100) with quorum store be exploited to cause protocol violations or state divergence? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_block_limits()] [Validation Bypass] Can an attacker bypass sanitize_send_recv_block_limits() checks by providing configs where send > recv but passing validation due to logic errors in the inequality checks? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_block_limits()] [Error Message Injection] Can malicious config values cause the error message format in sanitize_send_recv_block_limits() to include user-controlled strings, enabling log injection attacks? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_block_limits()] [Integer Overflow in Comparison] Can integer overflow in send/recv comparisons within sanitize_send_recv_block_limits() cause validation to incorrectly pass when send > recv due to wrapping? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_block_limits()] [Partial Validation] Does sanitize_send_recv_block_limits() only check txns and bytes but miss other send/recv pairs (like inline_txns), allowing those to be exploited with send > recv? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_block_limits()] [Batch/Block Mismatch] Can an attacker craft configs where quorum_store.receiver_max_batch_txns exceeds various block limits, bypassing the checks in sanitize_batch_block_limits() to cause batch sizes larger than blocks? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_block_limits()] [Backpressure Loop Exploit] Can the for loop over pipeline_backpressure in sanitize_batch_block_limits() miss certain backpressure configurations, allowing batch sizes to exceed backpressure block limits? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_block_limits()] [Backoff Loop Exploit] Can the for loop over chain_health_backoff in sanitize_batch_block_limits() miss certain backoff configurations, allowing batch sizes to exceed backoff block limits? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_block_limits()] [Only Bytes Checked] Does sanitize_batch_block_limits() only validate batch bytes against block bytes for backpressure/backoff but miss transaction count validation, allowing txn count mismatches? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_block_limits()] [Type Conversion Vulnerability] Can casting receiver_max_batch_txns and receiver_max_batch_bytes to u64 in sanitize_batch_block_limits() cause overflow or truncation issues that bypass validation? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigSanitizer::sanitize()] [Incomplete Validation] Does sanitize() only call SafetyRulesConfig::sanitize() and QuorumStoreConfig::sanitize() but miss validating ConsensusConfig's own fields, leaving exploitable misconfigurations? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigSanitizer::sanitize()] [Mainnet Feature Check Bypass] Can the check for consensus-only-perf-test in mainnet be bypassed by manipulating chain_id or feature flags, allowing performance test features in production? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigSanitizer::sanitize()] [Conditional Chain ID] Can the optional chain_id parameter in sanitize() be exploited by passing None for mainnet configs to bypass mainnet-specific security checks? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigSanitizer::sanitize()] [Validation Order Attack] Can the order of validation calls (safety rules -> quorum store -> send/recv -> batch) be exploited where later checks assume earlier validations passed, but early checks missed issues? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigSanitizer::sanitize()] [Node Type Ignored] Does sanitize() receive node_type parameter but not use it for validation, allowing validators and fullnodes to use identical configs when they should differ? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigOptimizer::optimize()] [Pre-commit Manipulation] Can a VFN or PFN operator override the optimize() logic that disables enable_pre_commit by manually setting it in local_consensus_config_yaml, potentially causing execution divergence? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigOptimizer::optimize()] [Node Type Bypass] Can an attacker misconfigure node_type to be Validator when running a fullnode, causing optimize() to leave enable_pre_commit enabled and creating execution inconsistencies? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigOptimizer::optimize()] [Yaml Injection] Can malicious yaml content in local_config_yaml be exploited to inject unexpected values through the ['consensus']['enable_pre_commit'] path access? (Medium)
